p: The belief is that failure to hold this ceremony, the spirits of the dead will strike back and will manifest as family misfortune such as more deaths and poor harvests. During these ceremonies, local tents ( bolo) partitioned into small rooms to accommodate visitors are constructed. It is custom that a child should be conceived during this ceremony to replace the dead. The bolo are designed to facilitate sexual intercourse by both youth and adults, some meeting for the first time, and in the process, exposing persons to risk of HIV acquisition.
